intro: Nototriche meyenii, commonly known as the Andean morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found growing in rocky or mountainous terrain. It thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Nototriche meyenii is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
